meanings.definition: The act or process of generating or producing offspring.
meanings.sent1: The genitures of animals involve the birth of their young.
meanings.sent2: Farmers play a crucial role in the genitures of crops by planting and harvesting.
meanings.sent3: The zookeeper joked that the genitures of the pandas were keeping her busy.
meanings.sent4: In the forest, the genitures of the trees create a beautiful canopy above.
meanings.sent5: The scientist studied the genitures of bacteria under the microscope.

meanings.definition: The position of the planets at the time of one's birth, believed by astrologers to influence one's personality and destiny.
meanings.sent1: Many people consult their horoscopes to learn about their genitures and future.
meanings.sent2: Astrologers study the genitures of individuals to provide insights into their lives.
meanings.sent3: During the party, the conversation turned to the genitures of the guests and their zodiac signs.
meanings.sent4: The ancient civilizations believed that the genitures of the stars determined their fates.
meanings.sent5: Looking up at the night sky, she pondered the genitures of the constellations.
